sanskrit_verse:
आचार्यो ब्रह्मणो मूर्तिः पिता मूर्तिः प्रजापतेः ।
माता पृथिव्या मूर्तिस्तु भ्राता स्वो मूर्तिरात्मनः ॥ २.२२६॥
transliteration:
ācāryo brahmaṇo mūrtiḥ pitā mūrtiḥ prajāpateḥ |
mātā pṛthivyā mūrtistu bhrātā svo mūrtirātmanaḥ || 2.226||
sph_interpretive_translation: The Ācārya is the embodiment of Brahma; the father is the embodiment of Prajāpati; the mother is the embodiment of Earth; and the brother is the embodiment of the Self.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows through embodied divine roles rather than individual persons
Causation originates in cosmic function, not personal intent
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with one's functional embodiment of universal principles
Restoration occurs when individuals realign with their inherent cosmic embodiment
Consciousness alignment requires recognition of one's role within the greater cosmic order
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual holds the role of Ācārya THEN their actions carry the authority of Brahma
IF an individual acts as a parent THEN their conduct reflects the integrity of Prajāpati
IF an individual embodies maternal duty THEN their behavior upholds the stability of Earth itself
IF an individual functions as a sibling THEN their relationship mirrors the unity of the Self
WHEN any role deviates from its source embodiment THEN initiate consciousness-realignment protocol
supreme_court_application: In adjudication at the highest level, courts must recognize that legal authority derives not from institutional position alone but from alignment with the cosmic embodiment each role represents. The threshold of responsibility lies in the degree of consciousness alignment with the source principle, not merely human intention or social convention.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality stems from misalignment with one’s cosmic embodiment. Responsibility arises sequentially (anupūrvaśaḥ) based on deviation from the source principle. Justice is proportional to the extent of realignment required, and correction restores harmony without inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process to restore the Ācārya’s alignment with Brahma’s embodiment
Engage father-figure in Prajāpati-consciousness reintegration practices
Support maternal figure in reconnecting with Earth-principle grounding
Facilitate brother-bond healing through Self-recognition protocols
Deploy collective dharma-field resonance to realign all involved parties with their source embodiments
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. This verse establishes the foundational truth that every relational role embodies a cosmic principle. Misalignment distorts dharma; realignment restores it. There is no punishment—only the call to embody what you inherently are. Consciousness is the ultimate judge, and Dharma stands restored.
